October 20,1996: Fiction
DESPERATION, by Stephen King. (Viking, $27.95.) Visitors to a small mining
town in Nevada encounter terrifying forces.
THE REGULATORS, by Richard Bachman. (Dutton, $24.95.) Killings and other
horrors disrupt a quiet suburban town in Ohio.
THE DEEP END OF THE OCEAN, by Jacquelyn Mitchard. (Viking, $23.95.) The
disappearance of a 3-year-old boy brings a family anguish and redemption.
EXECUTIVE ORDERS, by Tom Clancy. (Putnam, $27.95.) Vice President Jack
Ryan has problems after the deaths of the President and most of the Cabinet,
Congress, the Joint Chiefs and the Supreme Court.
JACK AND JILL, by James Patterson. (Little, Brown, $24.95.) Alex Cross on the
trail of serial killers at large in Washington.
TO THE HILT, by Dick Francis. (Putnam, $24.95.) Trials and tribulations await a
reclusive painter summoned to the bedside of his dying stepfather.
THE CELESTINE PROPHECY, by James Redfield. (Warner, $17.95.) An ancient
manuscript, found in Peru, provides insights into achieving a fulfilling life.
LEGEND, by Jude Deveraux. (Pocket, $23.) A bride-to-be in modern-day Virginia
suddenly finds herself in 19th-century Colorado.
THE LAW OF LOVE, by Laura Esquivel. (Crown, $25.) In the 23d century, an
"astroanalyst" reacquaints her patients with their 14,000 previous incarnations;
accompanied by a music CD.
FALLING UP, by Shel Silverstein. (HarperCollins, $16.95.) Poems and drawings,
for children and grown-ups, celebrating strange characters and experiences.
THE RUNAWAY JURY, by John Grisham. (Doubleday, $26.95.) A woman in a
Mississippi Gulf Coast town sues a tobacco company for causing her husband's
death.
THE LAST DON, by Mario Puzo. (Random House, $25.95.) The aging head of a
Mafia family makes plans for his heirs' activities in Hollywood and Las Vegas.
SERVANT OF THE BONES, by Anne Rice. (Knopf, $26.) A dark angel seeking
redemption makes a perilous journey from ancient Babylon to modern Manhattan.
MY MANY COLORED DAYS, by Dr. Seuss. Illustrated by Steve Johnson and Lou
Fancher. (Knopf, $16.) Ways of looking at feelings and moods.
DIRT, by Stuart Woods. (HarperCollins, $24.) A gossip columnist's travails with a
member of the social scene who is apparently determined to get even with her.
October 20, 1996
Non-Fiction
THE DILBERT PRINCIPLE, by Scott Adams. (Harper Business, $20.) A satirical
look, in words and cartoons, at the current foibles of business and management.
THE RUN OF HIS LIFE, by Jeffrey Toobin. (Random House, $25.) An account of
the O. J. Simpson trial by a journalist and former prosecutor.
HOW GOOD DO WE HAVE TO BE? by Harold S. Kushner. (Little, Brown,
$21.95.) How a new understanding of guilt and forgiveness can change our lives.
ANGELA'S ASHES, by Frank McCourt. (Scribner, $24.) An Irish-American writer
recalls his childhood amid the miseries of Limerick.
SLOUCHING TOWARDS GOMORRAH, by Robert H. Bork. (Regan Books/
HarperCollins, $25.) An indictment of modern liberalism, by the former judge, for
recent declines in American culture and social life.
JAMES HERRIOT'S FAVORITE DOG STORIES, by James Herriot. (St. Martin's,
$17.95.) Ten tales recounted by the Yorkshire veterinarian, who died last year.
LOVE, LUCY, by Lucille Ball with Betty Hannah Hoffman. (Putnam, $24.95.) The
posthumous autobiography of the television star.
THE SEA HUNTERS, by Clive Cussler and Craig Dirgo. (Simon & Schuster, $24.)
The searches made for shipwrecks that occurred during the past 150 years.
UNLIMITED ACCESS, by Gary Aldrich. (Regnery, $24.95.) Events in the Clinton
White House as reported by an F.B.I. agent formerly on duty there.
MIDNIGHT IN THE GARDEN OF GOOD AND EVIL, by John Berendt. (Random
House, $23.) The mysterious death of a young man in Savannah, Ga.
JOURNEY TO JUSTICE, by Johnnie L. Cochran Jr. with Tim Rutten. (One
World/Ballantine, $26.) The autobiography of the chief defense lawyer in the O. J.
Simpson trial.
UNDAUNTED COURAGE, by Stephen E. Ambrose. (Simon & Schuster, $27.50.)
The story of how Thomas Jefferson sponsored Lewis and Clark's exploration.
HIS HOLINESS, by Carl Bernstein and Marco Politi. (Doubleday, $27.50.) The role
played by Pope John Paul II in the fall of Communism in Europe.
LEADING WITH MY CHIN, by Jay Leno with Bill Zehme. (HarperCollins, $22.) The
autobiography of the host of "The Tonight Show."
DOWNSIZE THIS! by Michael Moore. (Crown, $21.) Observations on the current
social and political scene by the director of "Roger & Me."
